<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_irq_notify:
```c
static int metal_linux_irq_notify(void)
{
	uint64_t val = 1;
	int ret;

	ret = write(irq_notify_fd, &val, sizeof(val));
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s failed\n", __func__);
	}
	return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_linux_irq_notify:
static void metal_linux_irq_set_enable(struct metal_irq_controller *irq_cntr,
				       int irq, unsigned int state)
{
	int offset, ret;

	if (irq < irq_cntr->irq_base ||
	    irq >= irq_cntr->irq_base + irq_cntr->irq_num) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "%s: invalid irq %d\n",
			  __func__, irq);
		return;
	}
	offset = irq - linux_irq_cntr.irq_base;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&irq_lock);
	if (state == METAL_IRQ_ENABLE)
		metal_bitmap_set_bit(irqs_enabled, offset);
	else
		metal_bitmap_clear_bit(irqs_enabled, offset);
	metal_mutex_release(&irq_lock);
	/* Notify IRQ thread that IRQ state has changed */
	ret = metal_linux_irq_notify();
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR,
			  "%s: failed to notify set %d enable\n",
			  __func__, irq);
	}
}
...
void metal_linux_irq_shutdown(void)
{
	int ret;

	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "%s\n", __func__);
	irq_handling_stop = true;
	metal_linux_irq_notify();
	ret = pthread_join(irq_pthread, NULL);
	if (ret) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to join IRQ thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
	}
	close(irq_notify_fd);
	metal_mutex_deinit(&irq_lock);
}
...
void metal_sys_finish(void)
{

	/* Shutdown IRQ handling */
	metal_linux_irq_shutdown();
	metal_linux_bus_finish();
	close(_metal.pagemap_fd);

}
</additional code>

explanation:
I have included all functions in the provided code that either implement metal_linux_irq_notify or call it (direct call sites). These are the only fragments in the supplied code that can participate in direct or indirect recursion involving metal_linux_irq_notify. Analysis of the call graph among the provided fragments shows no cycle: metal_linux_irq_set_enable -> metal_linux_irq_notify, metal_linux_irq_shutdown -> metal_linux_irq_notify, and metal_sys_finish -> metal_linux_irq_shutdown -> metal_linux_irq_notify. metal_linux_irq_notify itself does not call any of these callers, so there is no direct or indirect recursion apparent in the provided code.

I did not include other functions (e.g., metal_log, pthread_join, close, metal_linux_bus_finish, or any functions not shown) because their implementations are not provided and there is no evidence in the supplied code that they call back into metal_linux_irq_notify or into the call chain that would create a cycle. If metal_log or any omitted function were implemented to call metal_linux_irq_notify (or one of its callers), that could create indirect recursion and should be investigated; but based solely on the supplied code fragments there is no indication of such behavior, so those omitted functions are not flagged here.
